comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Another one with an odd title! And by "odd" I mean wrong. In reality, this is not the Carquing Bridge -- unless you mean car "queueing" -- it's "Carquinez." [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sp8254/340053446/] And, as a little "then & now" fact from me: where there was once one, there are now 3. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lslphoto/99575487/] In 1958, a similar parallel bridge was built alongside the original one to accommodate increasing traffic. Then in 2003, another new suspension bridge was opened to replace the original 1927 bridge. Read more about the history of the bridge(s) on Wikipedia.
